result.execSummary:
The defendant Deontae Sherdell Myles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10/30/2015 @ 1:30pm

Court is not opposed to early termination of probation, if the defendant has completed all the conditions. Agent is to notify the Court, if the agent feels that early termination would be appropriate.

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, assessments and surcharges including DNA and domestic violence surcharges and all applicable fees of supervision by the end of supervision or a civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that he may never possess a firearm.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program.
- Complete any assessment that the probation agent deems appropriate.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children only, otherwise No Contact with the victim without the approval of the Court.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deontae Sherdell Myles

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deontae Sherdell Myles in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Deontae Sherdell Myles in court with attorney Christian Eichenlaub for Alexis B Stewart.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to Count 2.

As to Count 2:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 2 MONTHS at the House of Corrections CONSECUTIVE to Count 1.

Court STAYED the sentences and placed the defendant on up to 14 months probation.  Court is not opposed to early termination of probation if the defendant has completed all the conditions. Agent is to notify the Court if the agent feels that early termination would be appropriate.


  Conditions of Probation:
- 30 days condition time. Court stayed commencement until pending probation reviews.
- Successfully complete a Batterers Intervention program.
- Complete any assessment that the probation agent deems appropriate.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Defendant may have contact with the vitcim through a third party to arrange time with children only, otherwise no contact with the victim without the approval of the court.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision, failure to do so results in a civil judgment.
All court costs, assessments, and surcharges (including DNA and domestic violence surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision.


Court advised the defendant that he may never possess a firearm.
Court is opposed to expungement.

Filed:  
Memoradum of Conditions of Probation  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deontae Sherdell Myles in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
AS TO COUNTS  1 & 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deontae Sherdell Myles in court with attorney T.R. Williams for Alexis B Stewart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding defense motion to modify no contact order. Court did not modify no contact order today, but will allow for contact with children as allowed in a visitation order approved by Family Court made after today's date. Defense counsel requests case be set for Jury Trial. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Jury Trial to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deontae Sherdell Myles in court with attorney T.R. Williams for Alexis B Stewart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. At request of parties, case adjourned for Bail/Bond Hearing in branch 23  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MAIYA L.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deontae Sherdell Myles in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Defendant Deontae Sherdell Myles in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Deontae Sherdell Myles
Current: 4323 N 61ST ST, Milwaukee, WI 53216   (Effective: 03-26-2015)
Prior: 5952 North 63rd Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
